Class IP

java.lang.Object
  fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.lib.ip.IP

public class IP
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class to deal with IP addresses and networks.

Author:
Patrick Lamaiziere

Method Detail

netmaskToPrefixLen

public static int netmaskToPrefixLen(java.math.BigInteger netmask)
                              throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Converts a netmask (IPv4) to a prefix length.

Parameters:
netmask - the BigInteger netmask to convert from.
Returns:
the length of the prefix.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - if the netmask can't be expressed as a prefix.

prefixLenToNetmask

public static java.math.BigInteger prefixLenToNetmask(int prefixLen,
                                                      IPversion ipVersion)
Converts a prefix length to a netmask.

Parameters:
prefixLen - the prefix to convert from.
ipVersion - the IPversion version of IP.
Returns:
the BigInteger netmask.

checkNetmask

public static boolean checkNetmask(java.math.BigInteger netmask,
                                   int masklen)
Checks if a netmask can be expressed as a prefix.

Parameters:
netmask - the BigInteger netmask to check.
masklen - the length the mask.
Returns:
true if the netmask can be expressed as a prefix.

checkNetaddrPrefixLen

public static boolean checkNetaddrPrefixLen(java.math.BigInteger netaddr,
                                            int prefixLen,
                                            IPversion ipVersion)
Checks if a BigInteger network IP address is compatible with a prefix.

Parameters:
netaddr - the network address to check.
prefixLen - the prefx length of the network.
ipVersion - the IPversion version of IP.
Returns:
true if the network IP address is compatible.

networkLength

public static java.math.BigInteger networkLength(int prefixLen,
                                                 IPversion ipVersion)
Returns the BigInteger length (ie the number of IP addresses) in a network.

Parameters:
prefixLen - the prefix length of the network
ipVersion - the IPversion version of IP.
Returns:
the BigInteger number of IP addresses

maxPrefixLen

public static int maxPrefixLen(IPversion ipVersion)
Returns the max prefix length according to the IP version.
  • IPv4: 32.
  • IPv6: 128.

Parameters:
ipVersion - the IPversion IP version of the prefix.
Returns:
the max prefix length

isValidPrefixLen

public static boolean isValidPrefixLen(int prefixLen,
                                       IPversion ipVersion)
Checks if a prefix length is valid according to the IP version.
  • IPv4: 0 <= prefix <= 32.
  • IPv6: 0 <= prefix <= 128.

Parameters:
prefixLen - the prefix length to check.
ipVersion - the IPversion IP version.
Returns:
true if the length is valid.

isValidIP

public static boolean isValidIP(java.math.BigInteger ip,
                                IPversion ipVersion)
Checks if an IP address is valid according to the IP version.
  • IPv4: 0 <= IP < 2^32.
  • IPV6: 0 <= IP < 2^128.

Parameters:
ip - the BigInteger IP address to check.
ipVersion - the IPversion IP version of the address.
Returns:
true if the IP address is valid.

highest1Bits

public static int highest1Bits(java.math.BigInteger number)
Returns the position of the highest bit set to "1" in a number.

Parameters:
number - a BigInteger number.
Returns:
the position of the highest bit set to "1". Or -1 if there is not bit equal to "1" (number == 0).

highest0Bits

public static int highest0Bits(java.math.BigInteger number)
Returns the position of the highest bit set to "0" in a number.

Parameters:
number - a BigInteger number.
Returns:
the position of the highest bit set to "0". Or -1 if there is no bit equal to "0".

ipv4ToStrings

public static java.lang.String[] ipv4ToStrings(java.math.BigInteger ip,
                                               int prefixlen)
Converts a BigInteger IP address into the string representation of the IP address and prefixlen.

Parameters:
ip - the BigInteger IP address to convert from.
prefixlen - the prefixlen to convert from.
Returns:
An array of two String strings. The first item String[0] contains a string representation of the IP address. The second item String[1] contains a string representation of the prefix.

ipv6ToStrings

public static java.lang.String[] ipv6ToStrings(java.math.BigInteger ip,
                                               int prefixLen,
                                               boolean compress)
Converts a BigInteger IP address into the string representation of the IP address and prefixlen.

Parameters:
ip - the BigInteger IP address to convert from.
prefixLen - the prefixlen to convert from.
compress - if true, the IP address representation try to use the short IPv6 notation '::'.
Returns:
An array of two String strings. The first item String[0] contains a string representation of the IP address. The second item String[1] contains a string representation of the prefix.
